paper_abstract: We develop a data structure for maintaining a dynamic multiset that uses O(nIgIgn/Ign) bits and O(1) words, in addition to the space required by the n elements stored, supports searches in O(Ign) worst-case time and updates in O(Ign) amortized time. Compared to earlier data structures, we improve the space requirements from O(n) bits to O(nIgIgn/Ign) bits, but the running time of updates is amortized, not worst-case. (C) 2010 Published by Elsevier B.V.
paper_title: A compact data structure for representing a dynamic multiset
